text: CHAPTER XX
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: A HIGHLAND FEAST
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Ere Waverley entered the banqueting hall, he was offered the patriarchal
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: refreshment of a bath for the feet, which the sultry weather, and the
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: morasses he had traversed, rendered highly acceptable. He was not,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: indeed, so luxuriously attended upon this occasion as the heroic
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: travellers in the Odyssey; the task of ablution and abstersion being
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: performed, not by a beautiful damsel, trained
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: To chafe the limb, and pour the fragrant oil,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: but by a smoke-dried skinny old Highland woman, who did not seem to
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: think herself much honoured by the duty imposed upon her, but muttered
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: between her teeth, 'Our father's herds did not feed so near together,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: that I should do you this service.' A small donation, however, amply
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: reconciled this ancient handmaiden to the supposed degradation; and, as
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Edward proceeded to the hall, she gave him her blessing, in the Gaelic
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: proverb, 'May the open hand be filled the fullest.'
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: The hall, in which the feast was prepared, occupied all the first storey
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: of Ian nan Chaistel's original erection, and a huge oaken table extended
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: through its whole length. The apparatus for dinner was simple, even to
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: rudeness, and the company numerous, even to crowding. At the head of
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: the table was the Chief himself, with Edward, and two or three Highland
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: visitors of neighbouring clans; the elders of his own tribe, wadsetters,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: and tacksmen, as they were called, who occupied portions of his estate
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: as mortgagers or lessees, sat next in rank beneath them, their sons,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: and nephews, and foster-brethren; then the officers of the Chief's
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: household, according to their order; and, lowest of all, the tenants
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: who actually cultivated the ground. Even beyond this long perspective,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Edward might see upon the green, to which a huge pair of folding doors
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: opened, a multitude of Highlanders of a yet inferior description, who,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: nevertheless, were considered as guests, and had their share both of
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: the countenance of the entertainer, and of the cheer of the day. In the
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: distance, and fluctuating round this extreme verge of the banquet, was a
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: changeful group of women, ragged boys and girls, beggars, young and old,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: large greyhounds, and terriers, and pointers, and curs of low degree;
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: all of whom took some interest, more or less immediate, in the main
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: action of the piece.
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: This hospitality, apparently unbounded, had yet its line of economy.
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Some pains had been bestowed in dressing the dishes of fish, game, &c.,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: which were at the upper end of the table, and immediately under the
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: eye of the English stranger. Lower down stood immense clumsy joints
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: of mutton and beef, which, but for the absence of pork, [17.]
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: abhorred in the Highlands, resembled the rude festivity of the banquet
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: of Penelope's suitors. But the central dish was a yearling lamb, called
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: 'a hog in har'st,' roasted whole. It was set upon its legs, with a bunch
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: of parsley in its mouth, and was probably exhibited in that form to
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: gratify the pride of the cook, who piqued himself more on the plenty
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: than the elegance of his master's table. The sides of this poor animal
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: were fiercely attacked by the clansmen, some with dirks, others with the
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: knives which were usually in the same sheath with the dagger, so that it
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: was soon rendered a mangled and rueful spectacle. Lower down still, the
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: victuals seemed of yet coarser quality, though sufficiently abundant.
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Broth, onions, cheese, and the fragments of the feast, regaled the sons
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: of Ivor who feasted in the open air.
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: The liquor was supplied in the same proportion, and under similar
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: regulations. Excellent claret and champagne were liberally distributed
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: among the Chief's immediate neighbours; whisky, plain or diluted, and
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: strong beer, refreshed those who sat near the lower end. Nor did this
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: inequality of distribution appear to give the least offence. Every one
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: present understood that his taste was to be formed according to the
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: rank which he held at table; and, consequently, the tacksmen and their
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: dependants always professed the wine was too cold for their stomachs,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: and called, apparently out of choice, for the liquor which was assigned
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: to them from economy. [See Note 18.] The bagpipers, three in number,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: screamed, during the whole time of dinner, a tremendous war-tune;
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: and the echoing of the vaulted roof, and clang of the Celtic tongue,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: produced such a Babel of noises, that Waverley dreaded his ears would
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: never recover it. Mac-Ivor, indeed, apologized for the confusion
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: occasioned by so large a party, and pleaded the necessity of his
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: situation, on which unlimited hospitality was imposed as a paramount
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: duty. 'These stout idle kinsmen of mine,' he said, 'account my estate
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: as held in trust for their support; and I must find them beef and
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: ale, while the rogues will do nothing for themselves but practise the
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: broadsword, or wander about the hills, shooting, fishing, hunting,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: drinking, and making love to the lasses of the strath. But what can I
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: do, Captain Waverley? everything will keep after its kind, whether it
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: be a hawk or a Highlander.' Edward made the expected answer, in a
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: compliment upon his possessing so many bold and attached followers.
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: 'Why, yes,' replied the Chief,' were I disposed, like my father, to put
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: myself in the way of getting one blow on the head, or two on the neck,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: I believe the loons would stand by me. But who thinks of that in the
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: present day, when the maxim is,--"Better an old woman with a purse in
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: her hand, than three men with belted brands?"' Then, turning to the
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: company, he proposed the 'Health of Captain Waverley, a worthy friend of
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: his kind neighbour and ally, the Baron of Bradwardine.'
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: 'He is welcome hither,' said one of the elders, 'if he come from Cosmo

author: Scott, Walter

title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

author: Scott, Walter

text: pledge the toast: 'I say nay to that;--while there is a green leaf in

author: Scott, Walter

text: the forest, there will be fraud in a Comyne.'

author: Scott, Walter

author: Scott, Walter

text: another ancient; 'and the guest that comes hither from him should be

author: Scott, Walter

author: Scott, Walter

author: Scott, Walter

text: enough of the race of Ivor on the hand of Bradwardine.'
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

author: Scott, Walter

text: was folded on his bosom. He then burst forth into what Edward justly
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: supposed to be an extemporaneous effusion of thanks, and praises of his
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Chief. It was received with applause, but did not produce the effect
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: of his first poem. It was obvious, however, that the clan regarded
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: the generosity of their Chieftain with high approbation. Many approved
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Gaelic toasts were then proposed, of some of which the Chieftain gave
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: his guest the following versions:--'To him that will not turn his back
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: on friend or foe.' 'To him that never forsook a comrade.' 'To him that
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: never bought or sold justice.' 'Hospitality to the exile, and broken
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: bones to the tyrant.' 'The lads with the kilts.' 'Highlanders, shoulder
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: to shoulder,'--with many other pithy sentiments of the like nature.
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Edward was particularly solicitous to know the meaning of that song
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: which appeared to produce such effect upon the passions of the
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: company, and hinted his curiosity to his host. 'As I observe,' said
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: the Chieftain, 'that you have passed the bottle during the last
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: three rounds, I was about to propose to you to retire to my sister's
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: tea-table, who can explain these things to you better than I can.
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Although I cannot stint my clan in the usual current of their festivity,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: yet I neither am addicted myself to exceed in its amount, nor do I,'
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: added he, smiling, 'keep a Bear to devour the intellects of such as can
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: make good use of them.'
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Edward readily assented to this proposal, and the Chieftain, saying a
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: few words to those around him, left the table, followed by Waverley. As
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: the door closed behind them, Edward heard Vich Ian Vohr's health invoked
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: with a wild and animated cheer, that expressed the satisfaction of the
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: guests, and the depth of their devotion to his service.

text: THE CHIEFTAIN'S SISTER
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: The drawing-room of Flora Mac-Ivor was furnished in the plainest and
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: most simple manner; for at Glennaquoich every other sort of expenditure
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: was retrenched as much as possible, for the purpose of maintaining, in
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: its full dignity, the hospitality of the Chieftain, and retaining and
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: multiplying the number of his dependants and adherents. But there was no
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: appearance of this parsimony in the dress of the lady herself, which
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: was in texture elegant, and even rich, and arranged in a manner which
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: partook partly of the Parisian fashion, and partly of the more simple
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: dress of the Highlands, blended together with great taste. Her hair was
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: not disfigured by the art of the friseur, but fell in jetty ringlets
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: on her neck, confined only by a circlet, richly set with diamonds. This
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: peculiarity she adopted in compliance with the Highland prejudices,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: which could not endure that a woman's head should be covered before
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: wedlock.
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Flora Mac-Ivor bore a most striking resemblance to her brother Fergus;
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: so much so, that they might have played Viola and Sebastian with the
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: same exquisite effect produced by the appearance of Mrs. Henry Siddons
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: and her brother, Mr. William Murray, in these characters. They had, the
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: same antique and regular correctness of profile; the same dark eyes,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: eyelashes, and eyebrows; the same clearness of complexion, excepting
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: that Fergus's was embrowned by exercise, and Flora's possessed the
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: utmost feminine delicacy. But the haughty, and somewhat stern regularity
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: of Fergus's features was beautifully softened in those of Flora. Their
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: voices were also similar in tone, though differing in the key. That of
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Fergus, especially while issuing orders to his followers during their
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: military exercise, reminded Edward of a favourite passage in the
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: description of Emetrius:
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: --whose voice was heard around,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Loud as a trumpet with a silver sound.
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: That of Flora, on the contrary, was soft and sweet,--'an excellent thing
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: in woman;' yet, in urging any favourite topic, which she often pursued
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: with natural eloquence, it possessed as well the tones which impress awe
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: and conviction, as those of persuasive insinuation. The eager glance of
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: the keen black eye, which in the Chieftain seemed impatient even of the
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: material obstacles it encountered, had, in his sister, acquired a gentle
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: pensiveness. His looks seemed to seek glory, power, all that could exalt
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: him above others in the race of humanity; while those of his sister,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: as if she were already conscious of mental superiority, seemed to pity,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: rather than envy, those who were struggling for any further distinction.
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Her sentiments corresponded with the expression of her countenance.
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Early education had impressed upon her mind, as well as on that of the
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Chieftain, the most devoted attachment to the exiled family of Stuart.
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: She believed if the duty of her brother, of his clan, of every man in
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Britain, at whatever personal hazard, to contribute to that restoration
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: which the partisans of the Chevalier de St. George had not ceased
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: to hope for. For this she was prepared to do all, to suffer all,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: to sacrifice all. But her loyalty, as it exceeded her brother's in
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: fanaticism, excelled it also in purity. Accustomed to petty intrigue,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: and necessarily involved in a thousand paltry and selfish discussions,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: ambitious also by nature, his political faith was tinctured, at least,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: if not tainted, by the views of interest and advancement so easily
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: combined with it; and at the moment he should unsheathe his claymore,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: it might be difficult to say whether it would be most with the view of
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: making James Stuart a king, or Fergus Mac-Ivor an earl. This, indeed,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: was a mixture of feeling which he did not avow even to himself, but it
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: existed, nevertheless, in a powerful degree.
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: In Flora's bosom, on the contrary, the zeal of loyalty burnt pure and
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: unmixed with any selfish feeling; she would have as soon made religion
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: the mask of ambitious and interested views, as have shrouded them
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: under the opinions which she had been taught to think patriotism. Such
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: instances of devotion were not uncommon among the followers of the
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: unhappy race of Stuart, of which many memorable proofs will recur to the
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: mind of most of my readers. But peculiar attention on the part of the
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Chevalier de St. George and his princess to the parents of Fergus and
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: his sister, and to themselves when orphans, had riveted their faith.
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Fergus, upon the death of his parents, had been for some time a page of
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: honour in the train of the Chevalier's lady, and, from his beauty
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: and sprightly temper, was uniformly treated by her with the utmost
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: distinction. This was also extended to Flora, who was maintained for
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: some time at a convent of the first order, at the princess's expense,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: and removed from thence into her own family, where she spent nearly two
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: years. Both brother and sister retained the deepest and most grateful
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: sense of her kindness.
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Having thus touched upon the leading principle of Flora's character, I
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: may dismiss the rest more slightly. She was highly accomplished, and
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: had acquired those elegant manners to be expected from one who, in early
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: youth, had been the companion of a princess; yet she had not learned
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: to substitute the gloss of politeness for the reality of feeling.
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: When settled in the lonely regions of Glennaquoich, she found that her
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: resources in French, English, and Italian literature, were likely to
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: be few and interrupted; and, in order to fill up the vacant time, she
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: bestowed a part of it upon the music and poetical traditions of the
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Highlanders, and began really to feel the pleasure in the pursuit, which
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: her brother, whose perceptions of literary merit were more blunt, rather
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: affected for the sake of popularity than actually experienced. Her
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: resolution was strengthened in these researches by the extreme delight
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: which her inquiries seemed to afford those to whom she resorted for
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: information.
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Her love of her clan, an attachment which was almost hereditary in
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: her bosom, was, like her loyalty, a more pure passion than that of
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: her brother. He was too thorough a politician, regarded his patriarchal
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: influence too much as the means of accomplishing his own aggrandizement,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: that we should term him the model of a Highland Chieftain. Flora felt
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: the same anxiety for cherishing and extending their patriarchal sway,

author: Scott, Walter

text: but it was with the generous desire of vindicating from poverty, or at
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: least from want and foreign oppression, those whom her brother was by
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: birth, according to the notions of the time and country, entitled to
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

author: Scott, Walter

author: Scott, Walter

author: Scott, Walter

title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: to procure something which they might share with the Chief as a proof of
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: afforded by the rude hospitality of his castle, and the general division
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: and subdivision of his estate among them. Flora was so much beloved by
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: them, that when Mac-Murrough composed a song in which he enumerated all
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: the principal beauties of the district, and intimated her superiority
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: by concluding; that 'the fairest apple hung on the highest bough,'
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: he received, in donatives from the individuals of the clan, more
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: seed-barley than would have sowed his Highland Parnassus, the Bard's
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: croft as it was called, ten times over.

author: Scott, Walter

title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

author: Scott, Walter

author: Scott, Walter

title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

author: Scott, Walter

text: of wishes was so limited, that none arose but what he was willing to
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

author: Scott, Walter

author: Scott, Walter

title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: muse, not the less so perhaps that he does not understand a word of her

author: Scott, Walter

author: Scott, Walter

author: Scott, Walter

author: Scott, Walter

title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since

text: feather, you are provided with a version; for I know you are in all the

author: Scott, Walter

text: bard's councils, and acquainted with his songs long before he rehearses

author: Scott, Walter

text: them in the hall.'

author: Scott, Walter

author: Scott, Walter

title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since

author: Scott, Walter

title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since

title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: sensation. Others are more modern, the composition of those family bards

author: Scott, Walter

text: whom the chieftains of more distinguished name and power retain as the
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since

author: Scott, Walter

author: Scott, Walter

author: Scott, Walter

author: Scott, Walter

title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: table.]

author: Scott, Walter

author: Scott, Walter

author: Scott, Walter

author: Scott, Walter

text: 'And am I wrong in conjecturing, however extraordinary the guess

author: Scott, Walter

author: Scott, Walter

title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

author: Scott, Walter

author: Scott, Walter

text: 'I would give my best horse to know what the Highland bard could find to

author: Scott, Walter

author: Scott, Walter

text: 'It shall not even cost you a lock of his mane.--Una, MAVOURNEEN! (She

author: Scott, Walter

author: Scott, Walter

title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

author: Scott, Walter

author: Scott, Walter

title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: In a spot, about a quarter of a mile from the castle, two brooks, which
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since

author: Scott, Walter

author: Scott, Walter

author: Scott, Walter

text: uproar.
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: It was up the course of this last stream that Waverley, like a knight of
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: romance, was conducted by the fair Highland damsel, his silent guide.
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

author: Scott, Walter

title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since

title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since

author: Scott, Walter

author: Scott, Walter

author: Scott, Walter

author: Scott, Walter

text: one wish--the restoration of my royal benefactors to their rightful
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: throne. It is impossible to express to you the devotion of my feelings
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: to this single subject; and I will frankly confess, that it has so
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: occupied my mind as to exclude every thought respecting what is called
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: my own settlement in life. Let me but live to see the day of that happy
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: restoration, and a Highland cottage, a French convent, or an English
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: palace, will be alike indifferent to me.'
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: 'But, dearest Flora, how is your enthusiastic zeal for the exiled family
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: inconsistent with my happiness?'
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: 'Because you seek, or ought to seek in the object of your attachment,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: a heart whose principal delight should be in augmenting your domestic
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: felicity, and returning your affection, even to the height of romance.
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: To a man of less keen sensibility, and less enthusiastic tenderness of
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: disposition, Flora Mac-Ivor might give content, if not happiness; for
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: were the irrevocable words spoken, never would she be deficient in the
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: duties which she vowed.'
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: 'And why--why, Miss Mac-Ivor, should you think yourself a more valuable
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: treasure to one who is less capable of loving, of admiring you, than to
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: me?'
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: 'Simply because the tone of our affections would be more in unison, and
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: because his more blunted sensibility would not require the return of
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: enthusiasm which I have not to bestow. But you, Mr. Waverley, would for
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: ever refer to the idea of domestic happiness which your imagination
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: is capable of painting, and whatever fell short of that ideal
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: representation would be construed into coolness and indifference, while
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: you might consider the enthusiasm with which I regarded the success of
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: the royal family as defrauding your affection of its due return.'
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: 'In other words, Miss Mac-Ivor, you cannot love me?' said her suitor,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: dejectedly.
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: 'I could esteem you, Mr. Waverley, as much, perhaps more, than any man
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: I have ever seen; but I cannot love you as you ought to be loved. Oh!
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: do not, for your own sake, desire so hazardous an experiment! The woman
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: whom you marry ought to have affections and opinions moulded upon yours.
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Her studies ought to be your studies;--her wishes, her feelings, her
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: hopes, her fears, should all mingle with yours. She should enhance your
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: pleasures, share your sorrows, and cheer your melancholy.'
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: 'And, why will not you, Miss Mac-Ivor, who can so well describe a happy
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: union,--why will not you be yourself the person you describe?'
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: 'Is it possible you do not yet comprehend me?' answered Flora. 'Have I
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: not told you, that every keener sensation of my mind is bent exclusively
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: towards an event, upon which, indeed, I have no power but those of my
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: earnest prayers?'
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: 'And might not the granting the suit I solicit,' said Waverley, too
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: earnest on his purpose to consider what he was about to say, 'even
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: advance the interest to which you have devoted yourself? My family is
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: wealthy and powerful, inclined in principles to the Stuart race, and
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: should a favourable opportunity'--
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: 'A favourable opportunity!' said Flora, somewhat scornfully,--'inclined
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: in principles!--Can such lukewarm adherence be honourable to yourselves,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: or gratifying to your lawful sovereign?--Think, from my present
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: feelings, what I should suffer when I held the place of member in a
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: family where the rights which I hold most sacred are subjected to cold
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: discussion, and only deemed worthy of support when they shall appear on
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: the point of triumphing without it!'
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: 'Your doubts,' quickly replied Waverley, 'are unjust as far as concerns
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: myself. The cause that I shall assert, I dare support through every
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: danger, as undauntedly as the boldest who draws sword in its behalf.'
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: 'Of that,' answered Flora, 'I cannot doubt for a moment. But consult
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: your own good sense and reason, rather than a prepossession hastily
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: adopted, probably only because you have met a young woman possessed of
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: the usual accomplishments, in a sequestered and romantic situation. Let
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: your part in this great and perilous drama rest upon conviction, and not
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: on a hurried, and probably a temporary feeling.'
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Waverley attempted to reply, but his words failed him. Every sentiment
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: that Flora had uttered vindicated the strength of his attachment; for
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: even her loyalty, although wildly enthusiastic, was generous and noble,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: and disdained to avail itself of any indirect means of supporting the
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: cause to which she was devoted.
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: After walking a little way in silence down the path, Flora thus resumed
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: the conversation.--'One word more, Mr. Waverley, ere we bid farewell to
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: this topic for ever; and forgive my boldness if that word have the air
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: of advice. My brother Fergus is anxious that you should join him in his
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: present enterprise. But do not consent to this: you could not, by your
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: single exertions, further his success, and you would inevitably share
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: his fall, if it be God's pleasure that fall he must. Your character
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: would also suffer irretrievably. Let me beg you will return to your
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: own country; and, having publicly freed yourself from every tie to the
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: usurping government, I trust you will see cause, and find opportunity,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: to serve your injured sovereign with effect, and stand forth, as your
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: loyal ancestors, at the head of your natural followers and adherents, a
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: worthy representative of the house of Waverley.'
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: 'And should I be so happy as thus to distinguish myself, might I not
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: hope'--
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: 'Forgive my interruption,' said Flora. 'The present time only is ours,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: and I can but explain to you with candour the feelings which I now
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: entertain; how they might be altered by a train of events too favourable
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: perhaps to be hoped for, it were in vain even to conjecture: only be
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: assured, Mr. Waverley, that, after my brother's honour and happiness,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: there is none which I shall more sincerely pray for than for yours.'
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: With these words she parted from him, for they were now arrived where
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: two paths separated. Waverley reached the castle amidst a medley of
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: conflicting passions. He avoided any private interview with Fergus, as
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: he did not find himself able either to encounter his raillery, or reply
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: to his solicitations. The wild revelry of the feast, for Mac-Ivor kept
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: open table for his clan, served in some degree to stun reflection. When
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: their festivity was ended, he began to consider how he should again
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: meet Miss Mac-Ivor after the painful and interesting explanation of the
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: morning. But Flora did not appear. Fergus, whose eyes flashed when he
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: was told by Cathleen that her mistress designed to keep her apartment
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: that evening, went himself in quest of her; but apparently his
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: remonstrances were in vain, for he returned with a heightened
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: complexion, and manifest symptoms of displeasure. The rest of the
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: evening passed on without any allusion, on the part either of Fergus or
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Waverley, to the subject which engrossed the reflections of the latter,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: and perhaps of both.
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: When retired to his own apartment, Edward endeavoured to sum up the
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: business of the day. That the repulse he had received from Flora would
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: be persisted in for the present, there was no doubt. But could he hope
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: for ultimate success in case circumstances permitted the renewal of his
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: suit? Would the enthusiastic loyalty, which at this animating moment
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: left no room for a softer passion, survive, at least in its engrossing
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: force, the success or the failure of the present political machinations?
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: And if so, could he hope that the interest which she had acknowledged
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: him to possess in her favour, might be improved into a warmer
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: attachment? He taxed his memory to recall every word she had used, with
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: the appropriate looks and gestures which had enforced them, and ended
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: by finding himself in the same state of uncertainty. It was very late
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: before sleep brought relief to the tumult of his mind, after the most
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: painful and agitating day which he had ever passed.

title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: of Selma. He imagined himself transported back to Tully-Veolan, and that
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: generally to be the first sounds that disturbed his repose while a
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: guest of the Baron of Bradwardine. The notes which suggested this
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: vision continued, and waxed louder, until Edward awoke in earnest. The
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since

title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: in the fortress of Ian nan Chaistel, but it was still the voice of Davie

author: Scott, Walter

author: Scott, Walter

text: of such unwonted extent, Edward began to dress himself in all haste,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since

author: Scott, Walter

author: Scott, Walter

text: who always graced the gates of the castle with their presence, and was
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

author: Scott, Walter

author: Scott, Walter

title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

author: Scott, Walter

author: Scott, Walter

title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

author: Scott, Walter

author: Scott, Walter

title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: The contents of the letter greatly surprised him. It had originally
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: commenced with DEAR SIR; but these words had been carefully erased,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: and the monosyllable, SIR, substituted in their place. The rest of the
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: contents shall be given in Rose's own language:--
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: 'I fear I am using an improper freedom by intruding upon you, yet I
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: cannot trust to any one else to let you know some things which have
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: happened here, with which it seems necessary you should be acquainted.
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Forgive me if I am wrong in what I am doing; for, alas! Mr. Waverley, I
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: have no better advice than that of my own feelings;--my dear father
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: is gone from this place, and when he can return to my assistance
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: and protection, God alone knows. You have probably heard, that in
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: consequence of some troublesome news from the Highlands, warrants were
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: sent out for apprehending several gentlemen in these parts, and, among
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: others, my dear father. In spite of all my tears and entreaties that he
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: would surrender himself to the Government, he joined with Mr. Falconer
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: and some other gentlemen, and they have all gone northwards, with a body
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: of about forty horsemen. So I am not so anxious concerning his immediate
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: safety, as about what may follow afterwards, for these troubles are only
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: beginning. But all this is nothing to you, Mr. Waverley, only I thought
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: you would be glad to learn that my father has escaped, in case you
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: happen to have heard that he was in danger.
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: 'The day after my father went off, there came a party of soldiers to
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Tully-Veolan, and behaved very rudely to Bailie Macwheeble; but the
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: officer was very civil to me, only said his duty obliged him to search
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: for arms and papers. My father had provided against this by taking away
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: all the arms except the old useless things which hung in the hall; and
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: he had put all his papers out of the way. But oh! Mr. Waverley, how
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: shall I tell you that they made strict inquiry after you, and asked when
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: you had been at Tully-Veolan, and where you now were. The officer is

author: Scott, Walter

author: Scott, Walter

author: Scott, Walter

title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since

title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: in the envelope, and placing it on the table before him, returned the
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: original to Waverley, with an air of melancholy gravity.
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: with what he thought a reasonable time for reflection, Major Melville
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: resumed his examination, premising, that as Mr. Waverley seemed to
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: object to general questions, his interrogatories should be as specific

author: Scott, Walter

text: as his information permitted. He then proceeded in his investigation,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since

text: amanuensis, by whom it was written down.
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Did Mr. Waverley know one Humphry Houghton, a non-commissioned officer
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: in Gardiner's dragoons?'
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: 'Certainly; he was sergeant of my troop, and son of a tenant of my
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: uncle.'
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: 'Exactly--and had a considerable share of your confidence, and an
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: influence among his comrades?'
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: 'I had never occasion to repose confidence in a person of his
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: description,' answered Waverley. 'I favoured Sergeant Houghton as a
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: clever, active young fellow, and I believe his fellow soldiers respected
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: him accordingly.'
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: 'But you used through this man,' answered Major Melville, 'to
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: communicate with such of your troop as were recruited upon
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Waverley-Honour?'
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: 'Certainly; the poor fellows, finding themselves in a regiment chiefly
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: composed of Scotch or Irish, looked up to me in any of their little
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: distresses, and naturally made their countryman, and sergeant, their
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: spokesman on such occasions.'
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: 'Sergeant Houghton's influence,' continued the Major, 'extended, then,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: particularly over those soldiers who followed you to the regiment from
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: your uncle's estate?'
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: 'Surely;--but what is that to the present purpose?'
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: 'To that I am just coming, and I beseech your candid reply. Have you,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: since leaving the regiment, held any correspondence, direct or indirect,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: with this Sergeant Houghton?'
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: 'I!--I hold correspondence with a man of his rank and situation!--How,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: or for what purpose?'
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: 'That you are to explain;--but did you not, for example, send to him for
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: some books?'
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: 'You remind me of a trifling commission,' said Waverley, 'which I gave
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Sergeant Houghton, because my servant could not read. I do recollect I
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: bade him, by letter, select some books, of which I sent him a list, and
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: send them to me at Tully-Veolan.'
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: 'And of what description were those books?'
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: 'They related almost entirely to elegant literature; they were designed
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: for a lady's perusal.'
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: 'Were there not, Mr. Waverley, treasonable tracts and pamphlets among
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: them?'
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: 'There were some political treatises, into which I hardly looked. They
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: had been sent to me by the officiousness of a kind friend, whose heart
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: is more to be esteemed than his prudence or political sagacity; they
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: seemed to be dull compositions.'
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: 'That friend,' continued the persevering inquirer, 'was a Mr. Pembroke,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: a nonjuring clergyman, the author of two treasonable works, of which the
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: manuscripts were found among your baggage?'
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: 'But of which, I give you my honour as a gentleman,' replied Waverley,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: 'I never read six pages.'
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: 'I am not your judge, Mr. Waverley; your examination will be transmitted
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: elsewhere. And now to proceed--Do you know a person that passes by the
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: name of Wily Will, or Will Ruthven?'
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: 'I never heard of such a name till this moment.'
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: 'Did you never, through such a person, or any other person, communicate
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: with Sergeant Humphry Houghton, instigating him to desert, with as
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: many of his comrades as he could seduce to join him, and unite with the
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Highlanders and other rebels now in arms under the command of the young
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Pretender?'
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: 'I assure you I am not only entirely guiltless of the plot you have laid
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: to my charge, but I detest it from the very bottom of my soul, nor would
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: other man alive.'
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: 'Yet when I consider this envelope, in the handwriting of one of those
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: misguided gentlemen who are now in arms against their country, and the
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: verses which it enclosed, I cannot but find some analogy between the
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: enterprise I have mentioned and the exploit of Wogan, which the writer
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: seems to expect you should imitate.'
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Waverley was struck with the coincidence, but denied that the wishes
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: or expectations of the letter-writer were to be regarded as proofs of a
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: charge otherwise chimerical.
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: 'But, if I am rightly informed, your time was spent, during your absence
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: from the regiment, between the house of this Highland Chieftain,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: unfortunate cause?'
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: 'I do not mean to disguise it; but I do deny, most resolutely, being
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: privy to any of their designs against the Government.'
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: 'You do not, however, I presume, intend to deny, that you attended your
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

author: Scott, Walter

text: concert measures for taking arms?'
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: 'I acknowledge having been at such a meeting,' said Waverley; 'but I
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: neither heard nor saw anything which could give it the character you
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: affix to it.'
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

author: Scott, Walter

author: Scott, Walter

title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: heard that the person whom you mention was in the country.'
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

author: Scott, Walter

text: to direct his motions, as Major Melville would perceive from the letters
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: on the table.
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Major Melville accordingly perused the letters of Richard Waverley, of
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Sir Everard, and of Aunt Rachel; but the inferences he drew from them
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: were different from what Waverley expected. They held the language of
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: discontent with Government, threw out no obscure hints of revenge; and
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: that of poor Aunt Rachel, which plainly asserted the justice of the
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Stuart cause, was held to contain the open avowal of what the others
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: only ventured to insinuate.
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: 'Permit me another question, Mr. Waverley,' said Major Melville. 'Did
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: you not receive repeated letters from your commanding-officer, warning
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: you and commanding you to return to your post, and acquainting you with
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: the use made of your name to spread discontent among your soldiers?'
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: 'I never did, Major Melville. One letter, indeed, I received from him,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: containing a civil intimation of his wish that I would employ my leave
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: of absence otherwise than in constant residence at Bradwardine, as to
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: which, I own, I thought he was not called on to interfere; and, finally,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: I received, on the same day on which I observed myself superseded in the
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Gazette, a second letter from Colonel Gardiner, commanding me to join
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: the regiment,--an order which, owing to my absence, already mentioned
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: and accounted for, I received too late to be obeyed. If there were any
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: intermediate letters--and certainly, from the Colonel's high character,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: I think it probable that there were--they have never reached me.'
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: 'I have omitted, Mr. Waverley,' continued Major Melville, 'to inquire
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: after a matter of less consequence, but which has nevertheless been
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: publicly talked of to your disadvantage. It is said that a treasonable
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: his Majesty's commission, suffered the task of resenting it to devolve
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: upon another gentleman of the company. This, sir, cannot be charged
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: against you in a court of justice; but if, as I am informed, the
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: officers of your regiment requested an explanation of such a rumour,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: as a gentleman and soldier, I cannot but be surprised that you did not
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: afford it to them.'
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: This was too much. Beset and pressed on every hand by accusations, in
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: which gross falsehoods were blended with such circumstances of truth
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: as could not fail to procure them credit,--alone, unfriended, and in a
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: leaning his head upon his hand, resolutely refused to answer any further
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: questions, since the fair and candid statement he had already made had
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: only served to furnish arms against him.
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Without expressing either surprise or displeasure at the change in

author: Scott, Walter

title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: other queries to him. 'What does it avail me to answer you?' said

author: Scott, Walter

text: Edward, sullenly. 'You appear convinced of my guilt, and wrest every

author: Scott, Walter

text: reply I have made to support your own preconceived opinion. Enjoy your
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: supposed triumph, then, and torment me no further. If I am capable of
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

author: Scott, Walter

author: Scott, Walter

author: Scott, Walter

text: that it is so--then I do not see why I should, by my candour, lend my

author: Scott, Walter

text: accusers arms against my innocence. There is no reason I should answer

author: Scott, Walter

text: a word more, and I am determined to abide by this resolution.' And again
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: he resumed his posture of sullen and determined silence.
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: 'Allow me,' said the magistrate, 'to remind you of one reason that may

author: Scott, Walter

text: suggest the propriety of a candid and open confession. The inexperience

title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: and artful; and one of your friends at least--I mean Mac-Ivor of

author: Scott, Walter

text: intrigues.'

author: Scott, Walter

title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

author: Scott, Walter

author: Scott, Walter

author: Scott, Walter

author: Scott, Walter

title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since

title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since

author: Scott, Walter

title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Waverley awoke in the morning, from troubled dreams and unrefreshing
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: slumbers, to a full consciousness of the horrors of his situation. How
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: it might terminate he knew not. He might be delivered up to military
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: law, which, in the midst of civil war, was not likely to be scrupulous
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: in the choice of its victims, or the quality of the evidence. Nor did he
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: feel much more comfortable at the thoughts of a trial before a Scottish
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: court of justice, where he knew the laws and forms differed in many
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter
