title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: which he ought the first to have blushed. Why should I lament Gardiner?
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: his lot was happy, compared to mine!'
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: There was so much dignity in Colonel Talbot's manner, such a mixture
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: of military pride and manly sorrow, and the news of Sir Everard's
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: imprisonment was told in so deep a tone of feeling, that Edward stood
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: mortified, abashed, and distressed in presence of the prisoner, who
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: owed to him his life not many hours before. He was not sorry when Fergus
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: interrupted their conference a second time.
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: 'His Royal Highness commands Mr. Waverley's attendance.' Colonel Talbot
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: threw upon Edward a reproachful glance, which did not escape the quick
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: eye of the Highland Chief. 'His immediate attendance,' he repeated, with
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: considerable emphasis. Waverley turned again towards the Colonel.
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: 'We shall meet again,' he said; 'in the meanwhile, every possible
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: accommodation'--
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: 'I desire none,' said the Colonel; 'let me fare like the meanest of
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: those brave men, who, on this day of calamity, have preferred wounds and
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: captivity to flight; I would, almost exchange places with one of those
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: who have fallen, to know that my words have made a suitable impression
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: on your mind.'
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: 'Let Colonel Talbot be carefully secured,' said Fergus to the Highland
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: officer, who commanded the guard over the prisoners; 'it is the Prince's
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: particular command; he is a prisoner of the utmost importance.'
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: 'But let him want no accommodation suitable to his rank,' said Waverley.
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: signified his acquiescence in both commands, and Edward followed Fergus
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: to the garden-gate, where Callum Beg, with three saddle-horses, awaited
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: them. Turning his head, he saw Colonel Talbot reconducted to his place
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: of confinement by a file of Highlanders; he lingered on the threshold
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: of the door, and made a signal with his hand towards Waverley, as if
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: enforcing the language he had held towards him.

author: Scott, Walter

title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: blackberries; every man may have them for the catching. Come, let Callum
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

author: Scott, Walter

text: CHAPTER L
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: RATHER UNIMPORTANT
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: 'I was turned back,' said Fergus to Edward, as they galloped from
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Preston to Pinkie-house, 'by a message from the Prince. But, I suppose,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: you know the value of this most noble Colonel Talbot as a prisoner. He
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: is held one of the best officers among the red-coats; a special friend
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: and favourite of the Elector himself, and of that dreadful hero, the
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Duke of Cumberland, who has been summoned from his triumphs at Fontenoy,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: to come over and devour us poor Highlanders alive. Has he been telling
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: you how the bells of St. James's ring? Not "turn again, Whittington,"
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: like those of Bow, in the days of yore?'
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: 'Fergus!' said Waverley, with a reproachful look.
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: 'Nay, I cannot tell what to make of you,' answered the Chief of
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Mac-Ivor, 'you are blown about with every wind of doctrine. Here have we
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: gained a victory, unparalleled in history--and your behaviour is praised
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: by every living mortal to the skies--and the Prince is eager to thank
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: you in person--and all our beauties of the White Rose are pulling caps
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: for you,--and you, the PREUX CHEVALIER of the day, are stooping on your
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: horse's neck like a butter-woman riding to market, and looking as black
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: as a funeral!'
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: 'I am sorry for poor Colonel Gardiner's death: he was once very kind to
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: me.'
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: 'Why, then, be sorry for five minutes, and then be glad again; his
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: chance to-day may be ours to-morrow. And what does it signify?--the next
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: best thing to victory is honourable death; but it is a PIS-ALLER, and
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: one would rather a foe had it than one's self.'
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: 'But Colonel Talbot has informed me that my father and uncle are both
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: imprisoned by government on my account.'
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: 'We'll put in bail, my boy; old Andrew Ferrara [See Note 29.] shall
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: lodge his security; and I should like to see him put to justify it in
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Westminster Hall!'
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: 'Nay, they are already at liberty, upon bail of a more civic
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: disposition.'
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: 'Then why is thy noble spirit cast down, Edward? Dost think that the
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Elector's Ministers are such doves as to set their enemies at liberty
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: at this critical moment, if they could or durst confine and punish them?
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Assure thyself that either they have no charge against your relations on
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: which they can continue their imprisonment, or else they are afraid of
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: our friends, the jolly cavaliers of old England. At any rate, you need
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: not be apprehensive upon their account; and we will find some means of
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: conveying to them assurances of your safety.'
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Edward was silenced, but not satisfied, with these reasons. He had now
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: been more than once shocked at the small degree of sympathy which Fergus
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: exhibited for the feelings even of those whom he loved, if they did not
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: correspond with his own mood at the time, and more especially if they
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: thwarted him while earnest in a favourite pursuit. Fergus sometimes
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: indeed observed that he had offended Waverley, but, always intent upon
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: some favourite plan or project of his own, he was never sufficiently
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: aware of the extent or duration of his displeasure, so that the
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: reiteration of these petty offences somewhat cooled the volunteer's
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: extreme attachment to his officer.
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: The Chevalier received Waverley with his usual favour, and paid him many
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: compliments on his distinguished bravery. He then took him apart, made
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: many inquiries concerning Colonel Talbot, and when he had received all
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: the information which Edward was able to give concerning him and his
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: connexions, he proceeded,--'I cannot but think, Mr. Waverley, that
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: since this gentleman is so particularly connected with our worthy and
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: excellent friend, Sir Everard Waverley, and since his lady is of the
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: house of Blandeville, whose devotion to the true and loyal principles of
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: the Church of England is so generally known, the Colonel's own private
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: sentiments cannot be unfavourable to us, whatever mask he may have
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: assumed to accommodate himself to the times.'
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: 'If I am to judge from the language he this day held to me, I am under
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: the necessity of differing widely from your Royal Highness.'
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: 'Well, it is worth making a trial at least. I therefore entrust you with
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: the charge of Colonel Talbot, with power to act concerning him as you
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: think most advisable;--and I hope you will find means of ascertaining
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: 'I am convinced,' said Waverley, bowing, 'that if Colonel Talbot chooses
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: to grant his parole, it may be securely depended upon; but if he refuses
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: it, I trust your Royal Highness will devolve on some other person than
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: the nephew of his friend, the task of laying him under the necessary
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: restraint.'
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: 'I will trust him with no person but you,' said the Prince, smiling, but
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: peremptorily repeating his mandate: 'it is of importance to my service
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: that there should appear to be a good intelligence between you, even
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: if you are unable to gain his confidence in earnest. You will therefore
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: receive him into your quarters, and in case he declines giving his
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: parole, you must apply for a proper guard. I beg you will go about this
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: directly. We return to Edinburgh to-morrow.'
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since

title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

author: Scott, Walter

title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since

title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since

title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since

title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since

text: bring it into some exertion. The good-natured old gentleman, however,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: respectful hearing; and as for Waverley, he saw no reason why he should
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: had so unreasonably disturbed. The Baron then mentioned the matter
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: to the Prince, who, anxious to prevent quarrels in his little army,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: declared he would himself remonstrate with Colonel Mac-Ivor on the
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: unreasonableness of his conduct. But, in the hurry of their march, it
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: was a day or two before he had an opportunity to exert his influence in
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: the manner proposed.
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: In the meanwhile, Waverley turned the instructions he had received while
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: in Gardiner's dragoons to some account, and assisted the Baron in his
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: command as a sort of adjutant. 'PARMI LES AVEUGLES UN BORGNE EST ROI,'
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: says the French proverb; and the cavalry, which consisted chiefly of
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Lowland gentlemen, their tenants and servants, formed a high opinion of
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Waverley's skill, and a great attachment to his person. This was indeed
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: partly owing to the satisfaction which they felt at the distinguished
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

author: Scott, Walter

title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: the tribes in their vicinity, and all of them looked with a jealous eye
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

author: Scott, Walter

text: in the Prince's service.

author: Scott, Walter

text: It was Waverley's custom sometimes to ride a little apart from the main
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: body, to look at any object of curiosity which occurred on the march.
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: They were now in Lancashire, when, attracted by a castellated old hall,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: he left the squadron for half an hour, to take a survey and slight
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: sketch of it. As he returned down the avenue, he was met by Ensign
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Maccombich. This man had contracted a sort of regard for Edward since
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: the day of his first seeing him at Tully-Veolan, and introducing him to
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: the Highlands. He seemed to loiter, as if on purpose to meet with
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: our hero. Yet, as he passed him, he only approached his stirrup, and
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: pronounced the single word, 'Beware!' and then walked swiftly on,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: shunning all further communication.
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Edward, somewhat surprised at this hint, followed with his eyes the
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: course of Evan, who speedily disappeared among the trees. His servant,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Alick Polwarth, who was in attendance, also looked after the Highlander,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: and then riding up close to his master, said,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: 'The ne'er be in me, sir, if I think you're safe amang thae Highland
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: rintherouts.'
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: 'What do you mean, Alick?' said Waverley.
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: 'The Mac-Ivors, sir, hae gotten it into their heads, that ye hae
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: affronted their young leddy, Miss Flora; and I hae heard mae than ane
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: say, they wadna, tak muckle to make a black-cock o' ye; and ye ken
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: weel eneugh there's mony o' them wadna mind a bawbee the weising a ball
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: through the Prince himsell, an the Chief gae them the wink--or whether
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: he did or no,--if they thought it a thing that would please him when it
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: was dune.'
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Waverley, though confident that Fergus Mac-Ivor was incapable of such
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: treachery, was by no means equally sure of the forbearance of his
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: followers. He knew, that where the honour of the Chief or his family was
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: supposed to be touched, the happiest man would be he that could first
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: avenge the stigma; and he had often heard them quote a proverb, 'That
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: the best revenge was the most speedy and most safe.' Coupling this with
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: the hint of Evan, he judged it most prudent to set spurs to his horse,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: and ride briskly back to the squadron. Ere he reached the end of the
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: long avenue, however, a ball whistled past him, and the report of a
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: pistol was heard.
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: 'It was that deevil's buckie, Callum Beg,' said Alick; I saw him whisk
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: away through amang the reises.'
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Edward, justly incensed at this act of treachery, galloped out of the
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: avenue, and observed the battalion of Mac-Ivor at some distance moving
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: along the common, in which it terminated. He also saw an individual
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: running very fast to join the party; this he concluded was the intended
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: assassin, who, by leaping an enclosure, might easily make a much shorter
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: path to the main body than he could find on horseback. Unable to contain
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: himself, he commanded Alick to go to the Baron of Bradwardine, who was
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: at the head of his regiment about half a mile in front, and acquaint
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: him with what had happened. He himself immediately rode up to Fergus's
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: regiment. The Chief himself was in the act of joining them. He was on
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: horseback, having returned from waiting on the Prince. On perceiving
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Edward approaching, he put his horse in motion towards him.
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: 'Colonel Mac-Ivor,' said Waverley, without any further salutation, 'I
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: have to inform you that one of your people has this instant fired at me
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: from a lurking-place.
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: 'As that,' answered Mac-Ivor, 'excepting the circumstance of a
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: lurking-place, is a pleasure which I presently propose to myself, I
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: should be glad to know which of my clansmen dared to anticipate me.'
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: 'I shall certainly be at your command whenever you please;--the
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: gentleman who took your office upon himself is your page there, Callum
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Beg.'
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: 'Stand forth from the ranks, Callum! Did you fire at Mr. Waverley?'
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: 'No,' answered the unblushing Callum.
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: 'You did,' said Alick Polwarth, who was already returned, having met a
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: trooper by whom he dispatched an account of what was going forward to
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: the Baron of Bradwardine, while he himself returned to his master at
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: full gallop, neither sparing the rowels of his spurs, nor the sides of
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: his horse. 'You did; I saw you as plainly as I ever saw the auld kirk at
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Coudingham.'
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: 'You lie,' replied Callum, with his usual impenetrable obstinacy. The
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: combat between the knights would certainly, as in the days of chivalry,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: have been preceded by an encounter between the squires (for Alick was
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: a stout-hearted Merseman, and feared the bow of Cupid far more than
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: a Highlander's dirk or claymore), but Fergus, with his usual tone of
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: decision, demanded Callum's pistol. The cock was down, the pan and
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: muzzle were black with the smoke; it had been that instant fired.
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: 'Take that,' said Fergus, striking the boy upon the head with the heavy
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: pistol-butt with his whole force, 'take that for acting without orders,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: and lying to disguise it.' Callum received the blow without appearing to
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: flinch from it, and fell without sign of life. 'Stand still, upon your
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: lives!' said Fergus to the rest of the clan; 'I blow out the brains of
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: the first man who interferes between Mr. Waverley and me.' They stood
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: motionless; Evan Dhu alone showed symptoms of vexation and anxiety.
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Callum lay on the ground bleeding copiously, but no one ventured to give
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: him any assistance. It seemed as if he had gotten his death-blow.
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: 'And now for you, Mr. Waverley; please to turn your horse twenty yards
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: with me upon the common.' Waverley complied; and Fergus, confronting
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: him when they were a little way from the line of march, said, with great
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: affected coolness, 'I could not but wonder, sir, at the fickleness of
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: taste which you were pleased to express the other day. But it was not
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: an angel, as you justly observed, who had charms for you, unless she
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: brought an empire for her fortune. I have now an excellent commentary
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: upon that obscure text.'
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: 'I am at a loss even to guess at your meaning, Colonel Mac-Ivor, unless
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: it seems plain that you intend to fasten a quarrel upon me.'
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: 'Your affected ignorance shall not serve you, sir. The Prince,--the
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Prince himself, has acquainted me with your manoeuvres, I little thought
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: that your engagements with Miss Bradwardine were the reason of
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: your breaking off your intended match with my sister. I suppose the
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: information that the Baron had altered the destination of his estate,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: was quite a sufficient reason for slighting your friend's sister, and
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: carrying off your friend's mistress.'
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: 'Did the Prince tell you I was engaged to Miss Bradwardine?' said
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Waverley. 'Impossible.'
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: 'He did, sir,' answered Mac-Ivor; 'so, either draw and defend yourself,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: or resign your pretensions to the lady.'
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: 'This is absolute madness,' exclaimed Waverley, 'or some strange
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: mistake!'
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: 'Oh! no evasion! draw your sword!' said the infuriated Chieftain,--his
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: own already unsheathed.
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: 'Must I fight in a madman's quarrel?'
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: 'Then give up now, and for ever, all pretensions to Miss Bradwardine's
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: hand.'
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: 'What title have you,' cried Waverley, utterly losing command of
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: himself,--'What title have you, or any man living, to dictate such terms
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: to me?' And he also drew his sword.
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: At this moment the Baron of Bradwardine, followed by several of his
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: troop, came up on the spur, some from curiosity, others to take part in
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: the quarrel, which they indistinctly understood had broken out between
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: the Mac-Ivors and their corps. The clan, seeing them approach, put
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: themselves in motion to support their Chieftain, and a scene of
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: confusion commenced, which seemed likely to terminate in bloodshed.
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: A hundred tongues were in motion at once. The Baron lectured, the
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Chieftain stormed, the Highlanders screamed in Gaelic, the horsemen
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: cursed and swore in Lowland Scotch. At length matters came to such a
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: pass, that the Baron threatened to charge the Mac-Ivors unless they
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: resumed their ranks, and many of them, in return, presented their
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: fire-arms at him and the other troopers. The confusion was privately
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: fostered by old Ballenkeiroch, who made no doubt that his own day
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: of vengeance was arrived, when, behold! a cry arose of 'Room! make
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: way!--PLACE A MONSEIGNEUR! PLACE A MONSEIGNEUR!' This announced the
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: approach of the Prince, who came up with a party of Fitz-James's foreign
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: dragoons that acted as his bodyguard. His arrival produced some degree
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: of order. The Highlanders re-assumed their ranks, the cavalry fell in
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: and formed squadron, and the Baron and Chieftain were silent.
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: The Prince called them and Waverley before him. Having heard the
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: original cause of the quarrel through the villany of Callum Beg, he
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: ordered him into custody of the provost-marshal for immediate execution,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: in the event of his surviving the chastisement inflicted by his
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Chieftain. Fergus, however, in a tone betwixt claiming a right and
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: asking a favour, requested he might be left to his disposal, and
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: promised his punishment should be exemplary. To deny this, might have
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: of which they were very jealous, and they were not persons to be
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: disobliged. Callum was therefore left to the justice of his own tribe.
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: The Prince next demanded to know the new cause of quarrel between
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Colonel Mac-Ivor and Waverley. There was a pause. Both gentlemen found

title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since

title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Charles Edward was no sooner left with the Chieftain and Waverley, the
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: rest of his attendants being at some distance, than he said, 'If I owed
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: less to your disinterested friendship, I could be most seriously angry
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: with both of you for this very extraordinary and causeless broil, at a
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: moment when my father's service so decidedly demands the most perfect
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: unanimity. But the worst of my situation is, that my very best friends
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: hold they have liberty to ruin themselves, as well as the cause they are
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: engaged in, upon the slightest caprice.'
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Both the young men protested their resolution to submit every difference
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: to his arbitration. 'Indeed,' said Edward, 'I hardly know of what I am
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: accused. I sought Colonel Mac-Ivor merely to mention to him that I had
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: narrowly escaped assassination at the hand of his immediate dependent--a
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: dastardly revenge, which I knew him to be incapable of authorizing. As
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: to the cause for which he is disposed to fasten a quarrel upon me, I
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: am ignorant of it, unless it be that he accuses me, most unjustly,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: of having engaged the affections of a young lady in prejudice of his
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: pretensions.'
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: 'If there is an error,' said the Chieftain, 'it arises from a
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: conversation which I held this morning with his Royal Highness himself.'
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: 'With me?' said the Chevalier; 'how can Colonel Mac-Ivor have so far
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: misunderstood me?'
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: He then led Fergus aside, and, after five minutes' earnest conversation,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: spurred his horse towards Edward. 'Is it possible--nay, ride up,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Colonel, for I desire no secrets--Is it possible, Mr. Waverley, that
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: I am mistaken in supposing that you are an accepted lover of Miss
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Bradwardine?--a fact of which I was by circumstances, though not by
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: communication from you, so absolutely convinced, that I alleged it to
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Vich Ian Vohr this morning as a reason why, without offence to him, you
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: might not continue to be ambitious of an alliance, which to an unengaged
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: person, even though once repulsed, holds out too many charms to be
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: lightly laid aside.'
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: 'Your Royal Highness,' said Waverley, 'must have founded on
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: circumstances altogether unknown to me, when you did me the
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: distinguished honour of supposing me an accepted lover of Miss
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Bradwardine. I feel the distinction implied in the supposition, but I
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: have no title to it. For the rest, my confidence in my own merits is
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: too justly slight to admit of my hoping for success in any quarter after
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: positive rejection.'
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: The Chevalier was silent for a moment, looking steadily at them both,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: and then said, 'Upon my word, Mr. Waverley, you are a less happy man
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: than I conceived I had very good reason to believe you.--But now,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: gentlemen, allow me to be umpire in this matter, not as Prince Regent,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: but as Charles Stuart, a brother adventurer with you in the same gallant
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: cause. Lay my pretensions to be obeyed by you entirely out of view, and
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: consider your own honour, and how far it is well, or becoming, to give
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: our enemies the advantage, and our friends the scandal, of showing that,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: few as we are, we are not united. And forgive me if I add, that the
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: names of the ladies who have been mentioned, crave more respect from us
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: all than to be made themes of discord.'
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: He took Fergus a little apart, and spoke to him very earnestly for two
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: or three minutes, and then returning to Waverley, said--'I believe I
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: have satisfied Colonel Mac-Ivor that his resentment was founded upon
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: a misconception, to which, indeed, I myself gave rise; and I trust Mr.
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Waverley is too generous to harbour any recollection of what is past,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: when I assure him that such is the case.--You must state this matter
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: properly to your clan, Vich Iain Vohr, to prevent a recurrence of their
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: precipitate violence.' Fergus bowed. 'And now, gentlemen, let me have
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

author: Scott, Walter

title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: to appear most forward in concession. They did, however, shake hands,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: and parted, taking a respectful leave of the Chevalier. Charles Edward
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since

title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since

title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: accoutrements and state of discipline; took notice of the principal
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: gentlemen, and even of the cadets; inquired after their ladies,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: of Berwick.

author: Scott, Walter

author: Scott, Walter

text: CHAPTER LIX
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: A SKIRMISH
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: The reader need hardly be reminded, that, after a council of war held
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: at Derby on the 5th of December, the Highlanders relinquished their
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: desperate attempt to penetrate farther into England, and, greatly to the
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: dissatisfaction of their young and daring leader, positively determined
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: to return northward. They commenced their retreat accordingly, and by
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: the extreme celerity of their movements, outstripped the motions of
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: the Duke of Cumberland, who now pursued them with a very large body of
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: cavalry.
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: This retreat was a virtual resignation of their towering hopes. None had
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: been so sanguine as Fergus Mac-Ivor; none, consequently, was so cruelly
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: mortified at the change of measures. He argued, or rather remonstrated,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: with the utmost vehemence at the council of war; and, when his opinion
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: was rejected, shed tears of grief and indignation. From that moment
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: his whole manner was so much altered, that he could scarcely have been
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: recognized for the same soaring and ardent spirit, for whom the whole
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: earth seemed too narrow but a week before. The retreat had continued
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: for several days, when Edward, to his surprise, early on the 12th of
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: December, received a visit from the Chieftain in his quarters, in a
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: hamlet about half way between Shap and Penrith.
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Having had no intercourse with the Chieftain since their rupture, Edward
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: waited with some anxiety an explanation of this unexpected visit; nor
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: could he help being surprised, and somewhat shocked, with the change in
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: his appearance. His eye had lost much of its fire; his cheek was hollow,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: his voice was languid; even his gait seemed less firm and elastic
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: than it was wont; and his dress, to which he used to be particularly
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: attentive, was now carelessly flung about him. He invited Edward to
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: walk out with him by the little river in the vicinity; and smiled in
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: a melancholy manner when he observed him take down and buckle on his
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: sword.
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: As soon as they were in a wild sequestered path by the side of the
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: stream, the Chief broke out,--'Our fine adventure is now totally ruined,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Waverley, and I wish to know what you intend to do:--nay, never stare at
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: me, man. I tell you I received a packet from my sister yesterday, and,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: had I got the information it contains sooner, it would have prevented
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: a quarrel, which I am always vexed when I think of. In a letter written
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: after our dispute, I acquainted her with the cause of it; and she now
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: replies to me, that she never had, nor could have, any purpose of giving
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: you encouragement; so that it seems I have acted like a madman. Poor
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Flora! she writes in high spirits; what a change will the news of this
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: unhappy retreat make in her state of mind!'
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Waverley, who was really much affected by the deep tone of melancholy
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: with which Fergus spoke, affectionately entreated him to banish from his
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: remembrance any unkindness which had arisen between them, and they once
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: more shook hands, but now with sincere cordiality. Fergus again inquired
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: of Waverley what he intended to do. 'Had you not better leave this
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: luckless army, and get down before us into Scotland, and embark for
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: the Continent from some of the eastern ports that are still in our
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: possession? When you are out of the kingdom, your friends will easily
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: negotiate your pardon; and, to tell you the truth, I wish you would
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: your joint protection.' Edward looked surprised--'She loves you, and I
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: believe you love her, though, perhaps, you have not found it out, for
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: you are not celebrated for knowing your own mind very pointedly.' He
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: said this with a sort of smile.
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: 'How!' answered Edward,' can you advise me to desert the expedition in
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: which we are all embarked?'
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since

text: time for all who can, to get into the long-boat and leave her.'

author: Scott, Walter

author: Scott, Walter
