text: NOTE 7.--PERSECUTION OF EPISCOPAL CLERGYMEN
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: After the Revolution of 1688, and on some occasions when the spirit of
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: the Presbyterians had been unusually animated against their opponents,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: the Episcopal clergymen, who were chiefly non-jurors, were exposed to
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: be mobbed, as we should now say, or rabbled, as the phrase then went,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: to expiate their political heresies. But notwithstanding that the
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Presbyterians had the persecution in Charles II and his brother's time
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: to exasperate them, there was little mischief done beyond the kind of
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: petty violence mentioned in the text.
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: NOTE 8.--STIRRUP-CUP
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: I may here mention, that the fashion of compotation described in the
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: text, was still occasionally practised in Scotland in the author's
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: youth. A company, after having taken leave of their host, often went to
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: finish the evening at the clachan or village, in 'womb of tavern.' Their
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: entertainer always accompanied them to take the stirrup-cup, which often
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: occasioned a long and late revel.
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: The POCULUM POTATORIUM of the valiant Baron, his Blessed Bear, has a
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: prototype at the fine old Castle of Glamis, so rich in memorials of
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: ancient times; it is a massive beaker of silver, double gilt, moulded
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: into the shape of a lion, and holding about an English pint of wine. The
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: form alludes to the family name of Strathmore, which is Lyon, and, when
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: exhibited, the cup must necessarily be emptied to the Earl's health.
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: The author ought perhaps to be ashamed of recording that he has had the
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: honour of swallowing the contents of the Lion; and the recollection of
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: the feat served to suggest the story of the Bear of Bradwardine. In the
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: family of Scott of Thirlestane (not Thirlestane in the Forest, but the
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: place of the same name in Roxburghshire) was long preserved a cup of the
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: same kind, in the form of a jack-boot. Each guest was obliged to empty
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: this at his departure. If the guest's name was Scott, the necessity was
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: doubly imperative.
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: When the landlord of an inn presented his guests with DEOCH AN DORUIS,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: that is, the drink at the door, or the stirrup-cup, the draught was not
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: charged in the reckoning. On this point a learned Bailie of the town of
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Forfar pronounced a very sound judgement.
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: A., an ale-wife in Forfar, had brewed her 'peck of malt,' and set the
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: liquor out of doors to cool; the cow of B., a neighbour of A. chanced
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: to come by, and seeing the good beverage, was allured to taste it, and
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: finally to drink it up. When A. came to take in her liquor, she found
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: the tub empty, and from the cow's staggering and staring, so as to
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: betray her intemperance, she easily divined the mode in which her
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: 'brewst' had disappeared. To take vengeance on Crummie's ribs with a
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: stick, was her first effort. The roaring of the cow brought B., her
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: master, who remonstrated with his angry neighbour, and received in reply
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: a demand for the value of the ale which Crummie had drunk up. B. refused
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: payment, and was conveyed before C., the Bailie, or sitting Magistrate.
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: He heard the case patiently; and then demanded of the plaintiff A.,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: whether the cow had sat down to her potation, or taken it standing. The
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: plaintiff answered she had not seen the deed committed, but she supposed
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: the cow drank the ale standing on her feet; adding, that had she been
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: near, she would have made her use them to some purpose. The Bailie,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: on this admission, solemnly adjudged the cow's drink to be DEOCH
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: AN DORUIS--a stirrup-cup, for which no charge could be made without
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: violating the ancient hospitality of Scotland.
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: NOTE 9.--CANTING HERALDRY
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Although canting heraldry is generally reprobated, it seems nevertheless
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: to have been adopted in the arms and mottoes of many honourable
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: families. Thus the motto of the Vernons, VER NON SEMPER VIRET, is a
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: perfect pun, and so is that of the Onslows, FESTINA LENTE. The PERIISSEM
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: NI PER-IISSEM of the Anstruthers is liable to a similar objection. One
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: of that ancient race, finding that an antagonist, with whom he had
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: fixed a friendly meeting, was determined to take the opportunity of
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: assassinating him, prevented the hazard by dashing out his brains with
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: a battle-axe. Two sturdy arms brandishing such a weapon, form the usual
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: crest of the family, with the above motto--PERIISSEM NI PER-IISSEM--I
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: had died, unless I had gone through with it.
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: NOTE 10.--THE LEVYING OF BLACKMAIL
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Mac-Donald of Barrisdale, one of the very last Highland gentlemen who
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: carried on the plundering system to any great extent, was a scholar and
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: a well-bred gentleman. He engraved on his broadswords the well-known
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: lines--
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Hae tibi erunt artes--pacisque imponere morem,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Parcere subiectis, et debellare superbos.
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Indeed, the levying of blackmail was, before 1745, practised by several
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: chiefs of very high rank, who, in doing so, contended that they were
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: lending the laws the assistance of their arms and swords, and affording
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: a protection which could not be obtained from the magistracy in
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: the disturbed state of the country. The author has seen a memoir of
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Mac-Pherson of Cluny, chief of that ancient clan, from which it appears
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: that he levied protection-money to a very large amount, which was
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: willingly paid even by some of his most powerful neighbours. A gentleman
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: of this clan hearing a clergyman hold forth to his congregation on the
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: crime of theft, interrupted the preacher to assure him, he might leave
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: the enforcement of such doctrines to Cluny Mac-Pherson, whose broadsword
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: would put a stop to theft sooner than all the sermons of all the
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: ministers of the synod.
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: NOTE 11.--ROB ROY
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: An adventure, very similar to what is here stated, actually befell
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: the late Mr. Abercromby of Tullibody, grandfather of the present Lord
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Abercromby, and father of the celebrated Sir Ralph. When this
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: gentlemen, who lived to a very advanced period of life, first settled in
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Stirlingshire, his cattle were repeatedly driven off by the celebrated
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Rob Roy, or some of his gang; and at length he was obliged, after
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: obtaining a proper safe-conduct, to make the Cateran such a visit as
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: that of Waverley to Bean Lean in the text. Rob received him with much
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: courtesy, and made many apologies for the accident, which must have
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: happened, he said, through some mistake. Mr. Abercromby was regaled with
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: collops from two of his own cattle, which were hung up by the heels in
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: the cavern, and was dismissed in perfect safety, after having agreed to
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: pay in future a small sum of blackmail, in consideration of which Rob
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Roy not only undertook to forbear his herds in future, but to replace
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: any that should be stolen from him by other freebooters. Mr. Abercromby
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: said, Rob Roy affected to consider him as a friend to the Jacobite
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: interest, and a sincere enemy to the Union. Neither of these
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: circumstances were true; but the laird thought it quite unnecessary
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: to undeceive his Highland host at the risk of bringing on a political
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: dispute in such a situation. This anecdote I received many years since
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: (about 1792) from the mouth of the venerable gentleman who was concerned
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: in it.
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: NOTE 12.--KIND GALLOWS OF CRIEFF
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: This celebrated gibbet was, in the memory of the last generation, still
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: standing at the western end of the town of Crieff, in Perthshire. Why
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: it was called the kind gallows, we are unable to inform the reader with
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: certainty; but it is alleged that the Highlanders used to touch their
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: bonnets as they passed a place which had been fatal to many of their
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: countrymen, with the ejaculation--'God bless her nain sell, and the Teil
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: tamn you!' It may therefore have been called kind, as being a sort
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: of native or kindred place of doom to those who suffered there, as in
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: fulfilment of a natural destiny.
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: NOTE 13.--CATERANS
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: The story of the bridegroom carried off by Caterans on his bridal-day
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: is taken from one which was told to the author by the late Laird of
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Mac-Nab, many years since. To carry off persons from the Lowlands, and
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: to put them to ransom, was a common practice with the wild Highlanders,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: as it is said to be at the present day with the banditti in the south of
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Italy. Upon the occasion alluded to, a party of Caterans carried off
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: the bridegroom, and secreted him in some cave near the mountain of
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Schehallion. The young man caught the small-pox before his ransom could
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: be agreed on; and whether it was the fine cool air of the place, or the
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: want of medical attendance, Mac-Nab did not pretend to be positive; but
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: so it was, that the prisoner recovered, his ransom was paid, and he was
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: restored to his friends and bride, but always considered the Highland
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: robbers as having saved his life by their treatment of his malady.
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: NOTE 14.--RE-PURCHASE OF FORFEITED ESTATES
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: This happened on many occasions. Indeed, it was not till after the total
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: destruction of the clan influence, after 1745, that purchasers could be
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: found who offered a fair price for the estates forfeited in 1715,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: which were then brought to sale by the creditors of the York-Buildings
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Company, who had purchased the whole, or greater part, from Government
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: at a very small price. Even so late as the period first mentioned,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: the prejudices of the public in favour of the heirs of the forfeited
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: families threw various impediments in the way of intending purchasers of
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: such property.
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: NOTE 15.--HIGHLAND POLICY
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: This sort of political game ascribed to Mac-Ivor was in reality played
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: by several Highland chiefs, the celebrated Lord Lovat in particular, who
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: used that kind of finesse to the uttermost. The Laird of Mac-- was also
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: captain of an independent company, but valued the sweets of present pay
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: too well to incur the risk of losing them in the Jacobite cause. His
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: martial consort raised his clan, and headed it in 1745. But the chief
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: himself would have nothing to do with king-making, declaring himself for
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: that monarch, and no other, who gave the Laird of Mac-- 'half a guinea
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: the day, and half a guinea the morn.'
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: NOTE 16.--HIGHLAND DISCIPLINE
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: In explanation of the military exercise observed at the Castle of
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Glennaquoich, the author begs to remark, that the Highlanders were not
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: only well practised in the use of the broadsword, firelock, and most of
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: the manly sports and trials of strength common throughout Scotland, but
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: also used a peculiar sort of drill, suited to their own dress and mode
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: of warfare. There were, for instance, different modes of disposing
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: the plaid,--one when on a peaceful journey, another when danger was
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: apprehended; one way of enveloping themselves in it when expecting
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: undisturbed repose, and another which enabled them to start up with
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: sword and pistol in hand on the slightest alarm.
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Previous to 1720, or thereabouts, the belted plaid was universally worn,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: in which the portion which surrounded the middle of the wearer, and
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: that which was flung around his shoulders, were all of the same piece of
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: tartan. In a desperate onset, all was thrown away, and the clan charged
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: bare beneath the doublet, save for an artificial arrangement of the
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: shirt, which, like that of the Irish, was always ample, and for the
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: sporran-mollach, or goat's-skin purse.
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: The manner of handling the pistol and dirk was also part of the Highland
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: manual exercise, which the author has seen gone through by men who had
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: learned it in their youth.
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: NOTE 17.--HIGHLAND ABHORRENCE OF PORK
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Pork, or swine's flesh, in any shape, was, till of late years, much
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: abominated by the Scotch, nor is it yet a favourite food amongst them.
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: King Jamie carried this prejudice to England, and is known to have
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: abhorred pork almost as much as he did tobacco. Ben Jonson has recorded
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: this peculiarity, where the gipsy in a masque, examining the king's
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: hand, says,--
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: --'you should, by this line, Love a horse, and a hound, but no part of a
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: swine.'--THE GYPSIES METAMORPHOSED.
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: James's own proposed banquet for the devil was a loin of pork and a poll
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: of ling, with a pipe of tobacco for digestion.
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: NOTE 18.--A HIGHLAND CHIEF'S DINNER-TABLE
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: In the number of persons of all ranks who assembled at the same table,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: though by no means to discuss the same fare, the Highland Chiefs
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: only retained a custom which had been formerly universally observed
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: throughout Scotland. 'I myself,' says the traveller Fynes Morrison,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: in the end of Queen Elizabeth's reign, the scene being the Lowlands of
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Scotland, 'was at a knight's house, who had many servants to attend him,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: that brought in his meat with their heads covered with blue caps, the
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: table being more than half furnished with great platters of porridge
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: each having a little piece of sodden meat. And when the table was
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: served, the servants did sit down with us; but the upper mess, instead
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: of porridge, had a pullet, with some prunes in the broth.'--TRAVELS, p.
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Till within this last century, the farmers, even of a respectable
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: condition, dined with their work-people. The difference betwixt those of
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: high degree was ascertained by the place of the party above or below
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: the salt, or, sometimes, by a line drawn with chalk on the dining-table.
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Lord Lovat, who knew well how to feed the vanity and restrain the
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: appetites of his clansmen, allowed each sturdy Fraser, who had the
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: slightest pretension to be a Duinhe-wassel, the full honour of the
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: sitting, but, at the same time, took care that his young kinsmen did not
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: acquire at his table any taste for outlandish luxuries. His Lordship was
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: always ready with some honourable apology, why foreign wines and French
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: brandy--delicacies which he conceived might sap the hardy habits of his
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: cousins--should not circulate past an assigned point on the table.
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: NOTE 19.--CONAN THE JESTER
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: In the Irish ballads relating to Fion (the Fingal of Mac-Pherson), there
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: occurs, as in the primitive poetry of most nations, a cycle of heroes,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: each of whom has some distinguishing attribute: upon these qualities,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: and the adventures of those possessing them, many proverbs are formed
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: which are still current in the Highlands. Among other characters, Conan
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: is distinguished as in some respects a kind of Thersites, but brave and
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: daring even to rashness. He had made a vow that he would never take a
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: blow without returning it; and having, like other heroes of antiquity,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: descended to the infernal regions, he received a cuff from the
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Arch-fiend; who presided there, which he instantly returned, using the
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: expression in the text. Sometimes the proverb is worded thus:--'Claw
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: for claw, and the devil take the shortest nails, as Conan said to the
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: devil.'
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: NOTE 20.--WATERFALL
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: The description of the waterfall mentioned in this chapter is taken from
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: that of Ledeard, at the farm so called on the northern side of Lochard,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: and near the head of the Lake, four or five miles from Aberfoyle. It is
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: upon a small scale, but otherwise one of the most exquisite cascades
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: it is possible to behold. The appearance of Flora with the harp, as
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: described, has been justly censured as too theatrical and affected for
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: the ladylike simplicity of her character. But something may be allowed
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: to her French education, in which point and striking effect always make
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: a considerable object.
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: NOTE 21.--MAC-FARLANE'S LANTERN
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: The clan of Mac-Farlane, occupying the fastnesses of the western side
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: of Loch Lomond, were great depredators on the Low Country; and as their
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: excursions were made usually by night, the moon was proverbially called
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: their lantern. Their celebrated pibroch of HOGGIL NAM BO, which is the
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: name of their gathering tune, intimates similar practices,--the sense
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: being--
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: We are bound to drive the bullocks,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: All by hollows, hirsts, and hillocks,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Through the sleet and through the rain;
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: When the moon is beaming low
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: On frozen lake and hills of snow,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Bold and heartily we go;
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: And all for little gain.
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: NOTE 22.--CASTLE OF DOUNE
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: This noble ruin is dear to my recollection, from associations which have
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: been long and painfully broken. It holds a commanding station on the
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: banks of the river Teith, and has been one of the largest castles in
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Scotland. Murdock, Duke of Albany, the founder of this stately pile,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: was beheaded on the Castle-hill of Stirling, from which he might see the
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: towers of Doune, the monument of his fallen greatness.
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: In 1745-6, as stated in the text, a garrison on the part of the
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Chevalier was put into the castle, then less ruinous than at present. It
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: was commanded by Mr. Stewart of Balloch, as governor for Prince Charles
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: he was a man of property near Callander. This castle became at that time
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: the actual scene of a romantic escape made by John Home, the author of
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Douglas, and some other prisoners, who, having been taken at the battle
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: of Falkirk, were confined there by the insurgents. The poet, who had in
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: his own mind a large stock of that romantic and enthusiastic spirit of
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: adventure, which he has described as animating the youthful hero of his
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: drama, devised and undertook the perilous enterprise of escaping from
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: his prison. He inspired his companions with his sentiments and when
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: every attempt at open force was deemed hopeless, they resolved to twist
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: their bed-clothes into ropes, and thus to descend. Four persons, with
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Home himself, reached the ground in safety. But the rope broke with the
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: fifth, who was a tall lusty man. The sixth was Thomas Barrow, a brave
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: young Englishman, a particular friend of Home's. Determined to take the
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: risk, even in such unfavourable circumstances, Barrow committed himself
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: to the broken rope, slid down on it as far as it could assist him, and
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: then let himself drop. His friends beneath succeeded in breaking his
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: fall. Nevertheless, he dislocated his ankle, and had several of his ribs
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: broken. His companions, however, were able to bear him off in safety.
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: The Highlanders next morning sought for their prisoners with great
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: activity. An old gentleman told the author he remembered seeing the
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: commander Stewart,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Bloody with spurring, fiery red with haste,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: riding furiously through the country in quest of the fugitives.
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: NOTE 23.--JACOBITE SENTIMENTS
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: The Jacobite sentiments were general among the western counties, and in
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Wales. But although the great families of the Wynnes, the Wyndhams, and
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: others, had come under an actual obligation to join Prince Charles if
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: he should land, they had done so under the express stipulation, that he
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: should be assisted by an auxiliary army of French, without which they
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: foresaw the enterprise would be desperate. Wishing well to his cause,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: therefore, and watching an opportunity to join him, they did not,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: nevertheless, think themselves bound in honour to do so, as he was only
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: supported by a body of wild mountaineers, speaking an uncouth dialect,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: and wearing a singular dress. The race up to Derby struck them with more
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: dread than admiration. But it was difficult to say what the effect might
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: have been, had either the battle of Preston or Falkirk been fought and
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: won during the advance into England.
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: NOTE 24.--THE CHEVALIER'S IRISH OFFICERS
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Divisions early showed themselves in the Chevalier's little army, not
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: only amongst the independent chieftains, who were far too proud to brook
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: subjection to each other, but betwixt the Scotch and Charles's governor
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: O'Sullivan, an Irishman by birth, who, with some of his countrymen
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: bred in the Irish Brigade in the service of the King of France, had an
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: influence with the Adventurer much resented by the Highlanders, who
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: were sensible that their own clans made the chief, or rather the only
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: strength of his enterprise. There was a feud, also, between Lord George
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Murray, and James Murray of Broughton, the Prince's secretary, whose
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: disunion greatly embarrassed the affairs of the Adventurer. In general,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: a thousand different pretensions divided their little army, and finally
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: contributed in no small degree to its overthrow.
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: NOTE 25.--FIELD-PIECE IN THE HIGHLAND ARMY
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: This circumstance, which is historical, as well as the description that
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: precedes it, will remind the reader of the war of La Vendee, in which
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: the royalists, consisting chiefly of insurgent peasantry, attached a
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: prodigious and even superstitious interest to the possession of a piece
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: of brass ordnance, which they called Marie Jeanne.
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: The Highlanders of an early period were afraid of cannon, with the noise
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: and effect of which they were totally unacquainted. It was by means
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: of three or four small pieces of artillery that the Earl of Huntly and
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Errol, in James VI's time, gained a great victory at Glenlivat, over a
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: numerous Highland army, commanded by the Earl of Argyle. At the battle
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: of the Bridge of Dee, General Middleton obtained by his artillery a
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: similar success, the Highlanders not being able to stand the discharge
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: of MUSKET'S-MOTHER, which was the name they bestowed on great guns. In
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: an old ballad on the battle of the Bridge of Dee, these verses occur:--
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: The Highlandmen are pretty men
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: For handling sword and shield,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: But yet they are but simple men
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: To stand a stricken field.
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: The Highlandmen are pretty men
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: For target and claymore,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: But yet they are but naked men
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: To face the cannon's roar.
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: For the cannons roar on a summer night
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Like thunder in the air;
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Was never man in Highland garb
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Would face the cannon fair.
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: But the Highlanders of 1745 had got far beyond the simplicity of their
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: forefathers, and showed throughout the whole war how little they dreaded
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: artillery, although the common people still attached some consequence to
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: the possession of the field-piece which led to this disquisition.
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: NOTE 26.--ANDERSON OF WHITBURGH
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: The faithful friend who pointed out the pass by which the Highlanders
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: moved from Tranent to Seaton, was Robert Anderson, Junior, of Whitburgh,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: a gentleman of property in East Lothian. He had been interrogated by the
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Lord George Murray concerning the possibility of crossing the uncouth
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: and marshy piece of ground which divided the armies, and which he
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: described as impracticable. When dismissed, he recollected that there
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: was a circuitous path leading eastward through the marsh into the
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: plain, by which the Highlanders might turn the flank of Sir John Cope's
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: position, without being exposed to the enemy's fire. Having mentioned
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: his opinion to Mr. Hepburn of Keith, who instantly saw its importance,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: he was encouraged by that gentleman to awake Lord George Murray, and
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: communicate the idea to him. Lord George received the information with
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: grateful thanks, and instantly awakened Prince Charles, who was sleeping
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: in the field with a bunch of peas under his head. The Adventurer
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: received with alacrity the news that there was a possibility of bringing
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: an excellently provided army to a decisive battle with his own irregular
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: forces. His joy on the occasion was not very consistent with the charge
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: of cowardice brought against him by Chevalier Johnstone, a discontented
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: follower, whose Memoirs possess at least as much of a romantic as a
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: historical character. Even by the account of the Chevalier himself, the
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Prince was at the head of the second line of the Highland army during
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: the battle, of which he says, 'It was gained with such rapidity, that in
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: the second line, where I was still by the side of the Prince, we saw no
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: other enemy than those who were lying on the ground killed and wounded,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: THOUGH WE WERE NOT MORE THAN FIFTY PACES BEHIND OUR FIRST LINE, RUNNING
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: ALWAYS AS FAST AS WE COULD TO OVERTAKE THEM.'
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: This passage in the Chevalier's Memoirs places the Prince within fifty
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: paces of the best of the battle, a position which would never have been
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: the choice of one unwilling to take a share of its dangers. Indeed,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: unless the chiefs had complied with the young Adventurer's proposal
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: to lead the van in person, it does not appear that he could have been
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: deeper in the action.
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: NOTE 27.--DEATH OF COLONEL GARDINER
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: The death of this good Christian and gallant man is thus given by
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: his affectionate biographer Dr. Doddridge, from the evidence of
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: eye-witnesses:--
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: 'He continued all night under arms, wrapped up in his cloak, and
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: generally sheltered under a rick of barley, which happened to be in the
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: field. About three in the morning he called-his domestic servants to
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: him, of which there were four in waiting. He dismissed three of them
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: with most affectionate Christian advice, and such solemn charges
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: relating to the performance of their duty and the care of their souls,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: as seemed plainly to intimate that he apprehended it was at least very
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: probable he was taking his last farewell of them. There is great reason
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: to believe that he spent the little remainder of the time, which could
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: not be much above an hour, in those devout exercises of soul which had
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since

author: Scott, Walter

text: was ordered to furnish against a certain day. Murray happened to be out
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: of the way, which the Prince hearing of, called to have the gentleman
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: brought to him, saying, he would rather dispatch the business, whatever
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: it was, himself, than have the gentleman wait, which he did, by granting
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: everything that was asked. So much affability in a young prince, flushed
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: with victory, drew encomiums even from his enemies. But what gave the
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: people the highest idea of him, was the negative he gave to a thing that
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: very nearly concerned his interest, and upon which the success of
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: his enterprise perhaps depended. It was proposed to send one of the
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: prisoners to London, to demand of that court a cartel for the exchange
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: of prisoners taken, and to be taken, during this war, and to intimate
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: that a refusal would be looked upon as a resolution on their part to
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: give no quarter. It was visible a cartel would be of great advantage to
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: the Prince's affairs; his friends would be more ready to declare for him
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: if they had nothing to fear but the chance of war in the field; and
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: if the court of London refused to settle a cartel, the Prince was
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: authorized to treat his prisoners in the same manner the Elector of
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Hanover was determined to treat such of the Prince's friends as might
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: fall into his hands: it was urged that a few examples would compel the
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: court of London to comply. It was to be presumed that the officers of
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: the English army would make a point of it. They had never engaged in the
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: service but upon such terms as are in use among all civilized nations,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: and it could be no stain upon their honour to lay down their commissions
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: if these terms were not observed, and that owing to the obstinacy of
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: their own Prince. Though this scheme was plausible, and represented as
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: very important, the Prince could never be brought into it: it was below
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: him, he said, to make empty threats, and he would never put such as
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: those into execution; he would never in cold blood take away lives which
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: he had saved in heat of action, at the peril of his own. These were not
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: the only proofs of good nature the Prince gave about this time. Every
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: day produced something new of this kind. These things softened the
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: rigour of a military government, which was only imputed to the necessity
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: of his affairs, and which he endeavoured to make as gentle and easy as
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: possible.'
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: It has been said, that the Prince sometimes exacted more state and
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: ceremonial than seemed to suit his condition; but, on the other hand
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: some strictness of etiquette was altogether indispensable where he must
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: otherwise have been exposed to general intrusion. He could also endure,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: with a good grace, the retorts which his affectation of ceremony
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: sometimes exposed him to. It is said, for example, that Grant of
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Glenmoriston having made a hasty march to join Charles, at the head
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: of his clan, rushed into the Prince's presence at Holyrood with
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: unceremonious haste, without having attended to the duties of the
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: toilet. The Prince received him kindly, but not without a hint that
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: a previous interview with the barber might not have been wholly
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: unnecessary. 'It is not beardless boys,' answered the displeased Chief,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: 'who are to do your Royal Highness's turn.' The Chevalier took the
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: rebuke in good part.
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: On the whole, if Prince Charles had concluded his life soon after his
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: miraculous escape, his character in history must have stood very high.
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: As it was, his station is amongst those, a certain brilliant portion of
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: whose life forms a remarkable contrast to all which precedes, and all
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: which follows it.
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: NOTE 32.--THE SKIRMISH AT CLIFTON
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: The following account of the skirmish at Clifton is extracted from
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: the manuscript Memoirs of Evan Macpherson of Cluny, chief of the clan
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Macpherson who had the merit of supporting the principal brunt of that
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: spirited affair. The Memoirs appear to have been composed about 1755,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: only ten years after the action had taken place. They were written in
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: France, where that gallant Chief resided in exile, which accounts for
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: some Gallicisms which occur in the narrative.
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: 'In the Prince's return from Derby back towards Scotland, my Lord George
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Murray, Lieutenant-General, cheerfully charg'd himself with the command
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: of the rear; a post, which, altho' honourable, was attended with great
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: danger, many difficulties, and no small fatigue; for the Prince being
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: apprehensive that his retreat to Scotland might be cut off by Marischall
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Wade, who lay to the northward of him with an armie much superior to
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: what H. R. H. had, while the Duke of Comberland with his whole cavalrie
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: followed hard in the rear, was obliged to hasten his marches. It was
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: not, therefore, possible for the artilirie to march so fast as the
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Prince's armie, in the depth of winter, extremely bad weather, and
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: the worst roads in England; so Lord George Murray was obliged often to
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: continue his marches long after it was dark almost every night, while at
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: the same time, he had frequent allarms and disturbances from the Duke of
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Comberland's advanc'd parties. Towards the evening of the twentie-eight
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: December 1745, the Prince entered the town of Penrith, in the Province
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: of Comberland. But as Lord George Murray could not bring up the
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: artilirie so fast as he wou'd have wish'd, he was obliged to pass
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: the night six miles short of that town, together with the regiment of
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Mac-Donel of Glengarrie, which that day happened to have the arrear
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: guard. The Prince, in order to refresh his armie, and to give my Lord
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: George and the artilirie time to come up, resolved to sejour the 29th at
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Penrith; so ordered his little army to appear in the morning under arms,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: in order to be reviewed, and to know in what manner the numbers stood
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: from his haveing entered England. It did not at that time amount to
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: 5000 foot in all, with about 400 cavalrie, composed of the noblesse who
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: serv'd as volunteers, part of whom form'd a first troop of guards for
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: the Prince, under the command of My Lord Elchoe, now Comte de Weems,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: who, being proscribed, is presently in France. Another part formed a
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: second troup of guards under the command of My Lord Balmirino, who was
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: beheaded at the Tower of London. A third part serv'd under My Lord le
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Comte de Kilmarnock, who was likewise beheaded at the Tower. A fourth
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: part serv'd under My Lord Pitsligow, who is also proscribed; which
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: cavalrie, tho' very few in numbers, being all Noblesse, were very brave,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: and of infinite advantage to the foot, not only in the day of battle,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: but in serving as advanced guards on the several marches, and in
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: patroling dureing the night on the different roads which led towards the
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: towns where the army happened to quarter.
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: 'While this small army was out in a body on the 29th December, upon
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: a rising ground to the northward of Penrith, passing review, Mons. de
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Cluny with his tribe, was ordered to the Bridge of Clifton, about a
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: mile to southward of Penrith, after having pass'd in review before Mons.
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Patullo, who was charged with the inspection of the troops, and was
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: likewise Quarter Master General of the army, and is now in France. They
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: remained under arms at the Bridge, waiting the arrival of My Lord George
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Murray with the artilirie, whom Mons. de Cluny had orders to cover in
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: passing the bridge. They arrived about sunsett closely pursued by the
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Duke of Comberland with the whole body of his cavalrie, reckoned upwards
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: of 3000 strong, about a thousand of whom, as near as might be computed,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: dismounted, in order to cut off the passage of the artilirie towards the
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: bridge, while the Duke and the others remained on horseback in order to
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: attack the arrear. My Lord George Murray advanced, and although he
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: found Mons. de Cluny and his tribe in good spirits under arms, yet
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: the circumstance appear'd extremely delicate. The numbers were vastly
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: unequall, and the attack seem'd very dangerous; so my Lord George
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: declin'd giving orders to such time as he ask'd Mons. de Cluny's
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: oppinion. "I will attack them with all my heart," says Mons. de Cluny,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: "if you order me." "I do order it then," answered my Lord George, and
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: immediately went on himself along with Mons. de Cluny, and fought sword
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: in hand on foot, at the head of the single tribe of Macphersons. They
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: in a moment made their way through a strong hedge of thorns, under the
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: cover whereof the cavalrie had taken their station, in the struggle of
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: passing which hedge My Lord George Murray, being dressed EN MONTAGNARD,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: as all the army were, lost his bonnet and wig; so continued to fight
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: bare-headed during the action, They at first made a brisk discharge of
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: their firearms on the enemy, then attacked them with their sabres, and
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: made a great slaughter a considerable time, which obliged Comberland
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: and his cavalrie to fly with precipitation and in great confusion; in
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: so much, that if the Prince had been provided in a sufficient number of
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: cavalrie to have taken advantage of the disorder, it is beyond question
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: that the Duke of Comberland and the bulk of his cavalrie had been taken
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: prisoners. By this time it was so dark that it was not possible to view
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: or number the slain, who filled all the ditches which happened to be on
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: the ground where they stood. But it was computed that, besides those who
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: went off wounded upwards of a hundred at least were left on the spot,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: among whom was Colonel Honeywood, who commanded the dismounted cavalrie,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: whose sabre, of considerable value, Mons. de Cluny brought off and still
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: preserves; and his tribe lykeways brought off many arms;--the Colonel
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: was afterwards taken up, and, his wounds being dress'd, with great
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: difficultie recovered. Mons. de Cluny lost only in the action twelve
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: men, of whom some haveing been only wounded, fell afterwards into the
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: hands of the enemy, and were sent as slaves to America, whence several
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: of them returned, and one of them is now in France, a serjeant in the
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Regiment of Royal Scots. How soon the accounts of the enemie's approach
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: had reached the Prince, H. R. H. had immediately ordered Mi-Lord le
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Comte de Nairne, Brigadier, who, being proscribed, is now in France,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: with the three batalions of the Duke of Athol, the batalion of the Duke
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: of Perth, and some other troups under his command, in order to support
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Cluny, and to bring off the artilirie. But the action was intirely over
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: before the Comte de Nairne, with his command, cou'd reach nigh to the
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: place. They therefore return'd all to Penrith, and the artilirie marched

author: Scott, Walter

text: up in good order. Nor did the Duke of Comberland ever afterwards dare to
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

author: Scott, Walter

author: Scott, Walter

text: when in some manner surrounded by enemies.'
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: NOTE 33.--THE OATH UPON THE DIRK
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: As the heathen deities contracted an indelible obligation if they swore
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: by Styx, the Scottish Highlanders had usually some peculiar solemnity
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: attached to an oath which they intended should be binding on them. Very
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: frequently it consisted in laying their hand, as they swore, on their
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: own drawn dirk; which dagger, becoming a party to the transaction, was
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: invoked to punish any breach of faith. But, by whatever ritual the oath
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: was sanctioned, the party was extremely desirous to keep secret what the
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: especial oath was, which he considered as irrevocable. This was a matter
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: of great convenience, as he felt no scruple in breaking his asseveration
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: when made in any other form than that which he accounted as peculiarly
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: solemn; and therefore readily granted any engagement which bound him
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: no longer than he inclined. Whereas, if the oath which he accounted
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: inviolable was once publicly known, no party with whom he might have
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: occasion to contract, would have rested satisfied with any other. Louis
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: XI of France practised the same sophistry, for he also had a peculiar
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: species of oath, the only one which he was ever known to respect, and
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: which, therefore, he was very unwilling to pledge. The only engagement
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: which that wily tyrant accounted binding upon him, was an oath by the
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Holy Cross of Saint Lo d'Angers, which contained a Portion of the True
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Cross. If he prevaricated after taking this oath, Louis believed he
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: should die within the year. The Constable Saint Paul, being invited to a
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: personal conference with Louis, refused to meet the king unless he would
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: agree to ensure him safe conduct under sanction of this oath. But, says
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: Comines, the king replied, he would never again pledge that engagement
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: to mortal man, though he was willing to take any other oath which could
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: be devised. The treaty broke off, therefore, after much chaffering
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: concerning the nature of the vow which Louis was to take. Such is the
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: difference between the dictates of superstition and those of conscience.
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: GLOSSARY
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: ABIIT, EVASIT, ERUPIT, EFFUGIT, more correctly the quotation is, 'abiit,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: excessit, evasit, erupit': varying terms to express the haste, secrecy,
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: and energy of the flight.
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: ABOON or ABUNE, above.
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: ACCOLADE, embrace.
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: ADSCRIPTI GLEBAE, slaves, transferred with the land to which they are
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: bound, from one possessor to another.
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter

text: AHINT, behind.
title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
